==Events==
*[[1055]] &ndash; [[Theodora (11th century)|Theodora]] is crowned Empress of the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1158]] &ndash; [[Vladislav II of Bohemia|Vladislav II]] becomes King of [[Kingdom of Bohemia|Bohemia]].
*[[1569]] &ndash; First recorded [[lottery]] in England.
*[[1571]] &ndash; [[Archduchy of Austria|Austrian]] nobility is granted [[freedom of religion]].
*[[1693]] &ndash; [[1693 Sicily earthquake|A powerful earthquake]] destroys parts of Sicily and [[Malta]].
*[[1759]] &ndash; In [[Philadelphia|Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]], the first American [[life insurance]] company is incorporated.
*[[1779]] &ndash; [[Ching-Thang Khomba]] is crowned [[List of Meitei kings|King]] of [[Manipur]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; American Revolutionary War: French troops [[Siege of Brimstone Hill|begin a siege]] of a British garrison on Brimstone Hill in [[Saint Kitts]].
*[[1787]] &ndash; [[William Herschel]] [[Timeline of discovery of Solar System planets and their moons|discovers]] [[Titania (moon)|Titania]] and [[Oberon (moon)|Oberon]], two [[Moons of Uranus|moon]]s of [[Uranus]].
*[[1805]] &ndash; The [[Michigan Territory]] is created.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[Alabama]] secedes from the United States.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Arkansas Post]] &ndash; General [[John Alexander McClernand|John McClernand]] and Admiral [[David Dixon Porter]] capture the [[Arkansas River]] for the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]].
*  1863  &ndash; American Civil War: {{ship|CSS|Alabama}} [[Action off Galveston Light|encounters and sinks]] the {{USS|Hatteras|1861|6}} off Galveston Lighthouse in [[Texas]].
*[[1879]] &ndash; The [[Anglo-Zulu War]] begins.
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Grand Canyon National Park|Grand Canyon National Monument]] is created.
*[[1912]] &ndash; Immigrant textile works in [[Lawrence, Massachusetts]], [[1912 Lawrence Textile Strike|go on strike]] when wages are reduced in response to a mandated shortening of the work week.
*[[1917]] &ndash; The [[Kingsland Explosion|Kingsland munitions factory explosion]] occurs as a result of [[sabotage]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Romania]] reincorporates [[Transylvania]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; First use of [[insulin]] to treat [[Diabetes mellitus|diabetes]] in a human patient.
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Occupation of the Ruhr]]: Troops from France and Belgium occupy the [[Ruhr]] area to force Germany to make its [[World War I]] reparation payments.
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Louis B. Mayer]], head of film studio [[Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer]] (MGM), announces the creation of the [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]], at a banquet in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, California]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Amelia Earhart]] becomes the first person to fly solo from Hawaii to [[California]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The Japanese [[Battle of Kuala Lumpur|capture]] [[Kuala Lumpur]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The United States and United Kingdom give up territorial rights in China.
*  1943   &ndash; Italian-American anarchist [[Carlo Tresca]] is assassinated in New York City.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Greek Civil War]]: Last day of the [[Dekemvriana]] clashes in [[Athens]], Greece.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Enver Hoxha]], Secretary General of the [[Party of Labour of Albania|Communist Party of Albania]], declares the [[People's Socialist Republic of Albania|People's Republic of Albania]] with himself as head of state.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The first "networked" television broadcasts take place as [[KDKA-TV]] in [[Pittsburgh|Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]] goes on the air connecting the east coast and mid-west programming.
*  1949   &ndash; A record-setting snowstorm hits Los Angeles, California.
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[African Convention]] is founded in [[Dakar|Dakar, Senegal]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Henry Lee Lucas]], once listed as America's most prolific [[serial killer]], commits his first known murder.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]:  While tied to its pier in [[Russian Shipyard Number 10|Polyarny]], the [[Soviet submarine B-37]] is destroyed when fire breaks out in its torpedo compartment.
*  1962   &ndash; An avalanche on [[Huascarán]] in [[Peru]] causes 4,000 deaths.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Surgeon General of the United States]] Dr. [[Luther Terry]], M.D., publishes the landmark report ''[[Smoking and Health: Report of the Advisory Committee to the Surgeon General of the United States]]'' saying that smoking may be hazardous to health, sparking national and worldwide anti-smoking efforts.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[East Pakistan]] renames itself [[Bangladesh]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Major League Baseball]] owners vote in approval of the [[American League]] adopting the [[designated hitter]] position.
*[[1986]] &ndash; The [[Sir Leo Hielscher Bridges|Gateway Bridge, Brisbane]] in [[Queensland|Queensland, Australia]] is officially opened.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[Republic of Ireland|Irish]] Government announces the end of a 15-year broadcasting ban on the [[Official Irish Republican Army|IRA]] and its political arm [[Sinn Féin]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: [[STS-72]] launches from the [[Kennedy Space Center]] marking the start of the 74th [[Space Shuttle]] mission and the 10th flight of ''[[Space Shuttle Endeavour|Endeavour]]''.
*[[1998]] &ndash; Over 100 people are killed in the [[Sidi-Hamed massacre]] in [[Algeria]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Governor of Illinois|Illinois Governor]] [[George Ryan]] commutes the death sentences of 167 prisoners on [[Illinois]]' death row based on the [[Jon Burge]] scandal.
*[[2013]] &ndash; One French soldier and 17 militants are killed in a [[Bulo Marer hostage rescue attempt|failed attempt]] to free a French hostage in [[Bulo Marer]], [[Somalia]].
